title: If pipe A and pipe B can fill a tank in 4 hours and 2 hours respectively, how long will it take both pipes to fill the tank? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pipe A rate of full is 1/4. (1 tank in 4 hours). Pipe B rate is 1/2. Total rate of both pipes is 1/4 + 1/2 = 3/4. The units are still tanks/hour: 3 tanks per 4 hours. Time to fill one tank is the total rate “inverted” or 4 hours/3 tanks. Which means 4/3 hours per tank. Thats 1 and 1/3 hours to fill a tank.

Pipe A can fill the 1,000 litre tank in 4 hours (250 litres per hour)Pipe B can fill the 1,000 litre tank in 2 hours (500 litres per hour)Pipes A & B fill the 1,000 litre tank in Answer: 1 hour & 20 minutes. ( flow rate 0.75 per hour).
Vol = rate * timeR(a) * 4 = R(b) * 2R(a) = 0.5 R(b) let x be the time (hours) it take to fill the tank (same volume) with both pipes. (R(a) + R(b)) * x = R(b)*2 x = 4/3 hours

Pipe A fills (1/4)th of the tank in 1 hour. Pipe B fills (1/2) of the tank in 1 hour. Pipes A and B fill (1/4)+(1/2) = (1/4)+(2/4) = (3/4)th of the tank in 1 hour. So Taps A and B will fill the tank in 4/3 hours or 1 hour and 20 minutes or 80 minutes.
